{
  "Allegations" : "CUSTOMER ALLEGED THAT BETWEEN 2/2000 AND 8/2001 THE ACCOUNT MADE UNSUITABLE INVESTMENTS IN NASDAQ 100 AND 200 TRUST SECURITIES AND INDEX OPTIONS, AND MADE UNSUITABLE USE OF MARGIN, AGAINST THE CUSTOMER'S INSTRUCTIONS.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$60,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$35,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "I EMPHATICALLY DENY THE CUSTOMERS' CLAIM THAT I PURCHASED UNSUITABLE SECURITIES AND USED EXCESSIVE MARGIN AGAINST THEIR INSTRUCTIONS.  THE CUSTOMER WAS THOROUGHLY INVOLVED IN THE INVESTMENT DECISIONS FOR THE ACCOUNT AND WAITED MORE THAN A YEAR TO COMPLAIN ABOUT THE TRADES IN QUESTION.  MY FIRM AND I DECIDED TO SETTLE THE CLAIM IN AN EFFORT TO SAVE THE TIME, DISTRACTION, AND EXPENSE OF LITIGATION."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "WE RECEIVED A COPY OF A LETTER WRITTEN BY [CUSTOMER] TO HIS FATHER ABOUT THE POOR PERFORMANCE OF HIS ACCOUNT.  THE LETTER ALLEGED THE ACCOUNT WAS MISMANAGED BEGINNING NOVEMBER 2000.",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$63,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "[CUSTOMER'S] LETTER REFERRED TO THE POOR PERFORMANCE OF HIS PORTFOLIO AND ALLEGED I DID NOT FOLLOW HIS SUGGESTIONS TO CONVERT SOME OR ALL OF THE PORTFOLIO INTO CASH PRIOR TO A DECLINE IN VALUE.  DURING THE LIFE OF THE ACCOUNT WE HAD MANY CONVERSATIONS AND MEETINGS TO TALK ABOUT HIS PORTFOLIO AND HE NEVER SUGGESTED ALLOCATING MORE OF THE ACCOUNT TO CASH, NOR DID HE EVER COMPLAIN TO ME OR MY SUPERVISOR OF MY HANDLING OF THE ACCOUNT OR FAILURE TO FOLLOW HIS SUGGESTIONS.  WE DECIDED TO SETTLE THE MATTER RATHER THAN INCUR THE NUISANCE AND EXPENSE OF LITIGATION."
}
